thread.title: NFL players don't like the thought of being seen naked
thread.title_full: NFL players don't like the thought of being seen naked

author: Bay Area News Group
title: NFL players don't like the thought of being seen naked
text:
NFL players don't like the thought of being seen naked Bay Area News Group Posted: 10/21/2015 01:58:51 PM PDT Updated: 10/22/2015 07:34:04 AM PDT The internet was alive with chatter after an NFL Network post-game interview Sunday showed teammates of Bengals cornerback Adam Jones naked while walking to and from the showers while Jones was being interviewed on camera. 
Now NFL Players Association president Eric Winston, who happens to be an offensive tackle for the Bengals, is saying players around the league want policy changes when it comes to postgame locker room access for the media, saying ``this has been bubbling up for some guys over the years.'' 
Bengals tackle Andrew Whitworth, one of those shown, has been outspoken and said it would be ``a complete firestorm'' if it were women have been shown. 
``We can't always just serve women and everyone else. Men deserve a right, too. We have rights. We have privacy. We deserve all the things we want, as well. As a man, I think it's right the policy is changed.'' 
Or he could just wear a towel. Advertisement
